See [[WP:NONFREE]]. --> <!------See WikiProject Chinese-language entertainment-------> | name = Yip Sai Wing | caption = | chinesename = | tradchinesename = 葉世榮 | simpchinesename = 叶世荣 | pinyinchinesename = Ye4 Shi4 Rong2 | jyutpingchinesename = Yip9 Sai3 Wing4 | birthname = | ancestry = [[Taishan]], [[Guangdong]] | origin = [[Hong Kong]] | birthdate = {{birth date and age|1963|8|19}} | birthplace = [[Hong Kong]] | deathdate = | deathplace = | restingplace = | restingplacecoordinates = | othername = | occupation = Musician, singer-songwriter, record producer, manager | genre = [[Cantopop]], [[hard rock]], [[pop rock]] | instrument = Vocals, drums, percussion, guitar, violin, piano | voicetype = | label = | yearsactive = | currentmembers = | pastmembers = | associatedact = [[Beyond (band)|Beyond]] | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | influences = | influenced = | website = | hongkongfilmwards = | goldenbauhiniaawards = | hkfcsawards = | goldenhorseawards = | goldenroosterawards = | mtvasiaawards = | goldenmelodyawards = | ntsawards = | awards = }} '''Yip Sai Wing''' is a Hong Kong musician, singer, songwriter and the drummer of the Hong Kong rock band [[Beyond (band)|Beyond]]. He is the only remaining original member of Beyond. In 1983, Sai Wing, along with the late [[Wong Ka Kui]] and a few other friends, formed Beyond. In 2003, Beyond won the "Best Original Film Song" at the 23rd Annual Hong Kong Film Awards for "Vast Skies" (長空 or "Chang Kong"), which was written by Sai Wing and [[Wong Ka Keung]]. Starting from 2002, he started to develop his career in mainland China.
